00021 #ifdef BOOST_USE_WINDOWS_H
00022 #  include <windows.h>
00023 #endif
00024 
00025 #ifdef __BORLANDC__
00026 # pragma warn -8027     // Functions containing while are not expanded inline
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 namespace boost
00030 {
00031 
00032 namespace detail
00033 {
00034 
00035 #ifndef BOOST_USE_WINDOWS_H
00036 
00037 #ifdef _WIN64
00038 
00039 // Intel 6.0 on Win64 version, posted by Tim Fenders to [boost-users]
00040 
00041 extern "C" long_type __cdecl _InterlockedExchange(long volatile *, long);
00042 
00043 #pragma intrinsic(_InterlockedExchange)
00044 
00045 inline long InterlockedExchange(long volatile* lp, long l)
00046 {
00047     return _InterlockedExchange(lp, l);
00048 }
00049 
00050 #else  // _WIN64
00051 
00052 extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall InterlockedExchange(long volatile *, long);
00053 
00054 #endif // _WIN64
00055 
00056 extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall Sleep(unsigned long);
00057 
00058 #endif // #ifndef BOOST_USE_WINDOWS_H
00059 
00060 class lightweight_mutex
00061 {
00062 private:
00063 
00064     long l_;
00065 
00066     lightweight_mutex(lightweight_mutex const &);
00067     lightweight_mutex & operator=(lightweight_mutex const &);
00068 
00069 public:
00070 
00071     lightweight_mutex(): l_(0)
00072     {
00073     }
00074 
00075     class scoped_lock;
00076     friend class scoped_lock;
00077 
00078     class scoped_lock
00079     {
00080     private:
00081 
00082         lightweight_mutex & m_;
00083 
00084         scoped_lock(scoped_lock const &);
00085         scoped_lock & operator=(scoped_lock const &);
00086 
00087     public:
00088 
00089         explicit scoped_lock(lightweight_mutex & m): m_(m)
00090         {
00091             while( InterlockedExchange(&m_.l_, 1) )
00092             {
00093                 // Note: changed to Sleep(1) from Sleep(0).
00094                 // According to MSDN, Sleep(0) will never yield
00095                 // to a lower-priority thread, whereas Sleep(1)
00096                 // will. Performance seems not to be affected.
00097 
00098                 Sleep(1);
00099             }
00100         }
00101 
00102         ~scoped_lock()
00103         {
00104             InterlockedExchange(&m_.l_, 0);
00105 
00106             // Note: adding a yield here will make
00107             // the spinlock more fair and will increase the overall
00108             // performance of some applications substantially in
00109             // high contention situations, but will penalize the
00110             // low contention / single thread case up to 5x
00111         }
00112     };
00113 };
00114 
00115 } // namespace detail
00116 
00117 } // namespace boost
00118 
00119 #ifdef __BORLANDC__
00120 # pragma warn .8027     // Functions containing while are not expanded inline
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 #endif // #ifndef BOOST_DETAIL_LWM_WIN32_HPP_INCLUDED
